intro: Psilurus, commonly known as the creeping woodruff, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fragrant leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its stems are often prostrate, spreading along the ground to form dense mats. Psilurus is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
